results.title: How to drown
results.brief_description: A short treatise on how to drown. A facetious film, the purpose of which is to prevent people from acting thoughtlessly when swimming.

results.title: How to cure inflation
results.creator_credit: Graham Massey, Michael Latham and Video Arts
results.brief_description: Milton Friedman argues that inflation results when the rate of growth of money supply exceeds that of the production of goods and services. The cure is to slow the printing of money, causing short-term increases in unemployment and reductions in growth, but leading to long-term real growth. Suitable for middle and upper secondary and tertiary levels.

results.title: How to concentrate
results.brief_description: Demonstrates techniques which facilitate concentration - looking for answers to questions, selecting one idea at a time, avoiding distractions, and employing periodic relaxation. For junior and senior high school, college and adult groups.

results.title: How to Be Your Dog's Best Friend
results.creator_credit: Bernard Thompson, Royal Society for the Prvention of Cruelty to Animals (Australia) and Video Media Production
results.brief_description: Dog ownership can be a great joy. However, it is also a great responsibility. This video presents a wide variety of expert information presented in a simple format designed to help you become your dog’s best friend and to help you increase the joy of dog ownership; choosing your dog, bringing your dog home, toilet training, health and happiness, veterinary advice, dog behaviour. Rated: G

results.title: How to avoid decisions
results.creator_credit: Ted Robinson, Eve Ash, Australian Film Commission, Seven Dimensions and Victorian Film Corporation
results.brief_description: A humorous training video written by Ian McFadyen in the pre-Cleese era which aims to develop decision-making skills by examining common ways of avoiding decisions. A character called Art Dodger defends his title as World Decision-Avoiding champion and must prevent his staff from forcing him to face up to his decision making responsibilities. Provides a step-by-step process for effective decision-making. Cast includes Graeme Blundell.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Ted Robinson, Eve Ash, Australian Film Commission, Seven Dimensions and Victorian Film Corporation

results.title: How the west was lost: the story of the 1946 Aboriginal pastoral workers' strike
results.creator_credit: David Noakes, Heather Williams, Friends Film Productions and Market Street Films
results.brief_description: The story of the 1946 Aboriginal Pastoral Workers’ Strike. Eight hundred aboriginal station workers walked off sheep stations in the north west of Western Australia, marking the beginning of a strike which lasted more than three years. The strike was more than a demand for better wages and conditions, it was a struggle for basic human rights.
results.title_for_label: How the west was lost: the story of the 1946 Aboriginal pastoral workers’ strike

results.title: How the myth was made
results.creator_credit: George C. Stoney, James B. Brown and Films Incorporated
results.brief_description: Reconstructs the filming of Robert Flaherty’s film “Man of Aran”. Includes interviews with participants in the original project and raises questions about some scenes in the original film, which were of long discontinued activities re-enacted for the 1934 film. Suitable for upper secondary level.

results.title: How the motor car works
results.brief_description: This series explains the mechanics of the motor car, a machine that has changed the world profoundly, influencing economic and social development. Areas covered on the tape include the petrol engine, the carburettor, engine lubrication and the diesel engine.
